creditline: Gift of the artist and PATRON, Chicago
markings: verso on stretcher: 2 gallery labels, DC Moore Gallery and Patron Gallery
signed: verso URC in black: Claire Sherman / Trees 2018 18LG16
text: Firmly rooting her work in the traditions of landscape painting, the artist Claire Sherman brings us into a familiar, yet disorienting space. As brushstrokes overlap, so do the layers of the verdant scenery. The view is at once seemingly familiar, potentially a path likely in the woods, and disorienting, the distance between the trail and the sky could be a few feet or miles away. In drawing from her own memories or from photographs, Sherman is not depicting a particular path. Rather, "Trees" evokes the perception and sensation of such a scene.
title: Trees
